title: How do books improve our knowledge and improve our skills? - Quora

response.answer_text: First of all it depends on what kind of knowledge you want to improve . Only then you can select books based on topics and interest from myraid of books available . Let me explain what are positives you can attain from reading books based on each gener Reading any book basically improves your reading skills, such as compreheions and vocabulary.Reading books written in first person account, such novels can improve your conversation skills .Reading biographies and autobiography of your icons can give you a real life lessons, which will at some point of time, help you in making good decisions .Non fiction, in general, are great at giving you information such as ( what , why ,when , how ) on specific topic of your interest .Self help books are full of ideas ,tools and techniques for your personal development . (P.S read these books only of you are really serious in actively investing time using those technique in real life and making progress , otherwise it just gives a sense of delusion of improvement , but not in real life )To get the maximum out of subject books and textbooks , you should be committed to actively read and learn the subject matter using good learning tools such as “Feynman Techniques “ .Magazine are best to keep you updated about latest developments and trends in your interested field .I might have left out a few geners but those are all subcategory of above mentioned geners . I would also like to suggest few tips to improve your reading Keep a reading journal , jot down imp points or favourite quotes you come across while reading .If you lose interest while reading , do not push your self to complete the book it will just increase the hatred .Do read book review to select good books to read because it is your time that you are investing .Go for audio books if you are up for it .Hope these help , Happy reading .

Warren Buffett, one of the richest men in the world, once answered this in an interview when asked about the keys to his success. Pointing to a stack of books he said, “Read 500 pages like this every day. That's how knowledge works, it builds up, like compound interest. All of you can do it, but I guarantee not many of you will do it.” That's still the best answer I've found. Knowledge builds up over time when you read. Now how does that translate into skills? That requires acting on your knowledge, practicing what you've learned. If all you ever do is read but do not act on the knowledge, you might know a lot, but your abilities are unlikely to significantly improve. You can read about martial arts all you want for example, but until you practice it you will not be able to master it. It's the same with virtually any subject.
